author: Vonng (rh@vonng.com)
description: PostgreSQL Catalog Explorer for Single Database

panels.description:
Databases of this instance
Tmpl: is this database a template?
Conn: is this database connectable?

targets.rawSql:
SELECT d.datname, d.oid, d.datconnlimit, d.datfrozenxid, age(d.datfrozenxid) AS age, datistemplate,datallowconn,  1 - (datistemplate)::INTEGER + 2 * d.datallowconn::INTEGER AS status, psd.numbackends AS sessions,
       pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(d.datdba) as owner, pg_catalog.pg_encoding_to_char(d.encoding) as encoding,
       d.datcollate, d.datctype,  pg_catalog.array_to_string(d.datacl, E'\n') AS acl,
       CASE WHEN pg_catalog.has_database_privilege(d.datname, 'CONNECT') THEN pg_catalog.pg_database_size(d.datname) ELSE -1 END AS size,
       t.spcname as tablespace,
       pg_catalog.shobj_description(d.oid, 'pg_database') as description
FROM pg_catalog.pg_database d JOIN pg_catalog.pg_tablespace t on d.dattablespace = t.oid JOIN pg_stat_database psd on d.oid = psd.datid
ORDER BY 1;

SELECT d.datname, d.datconnlimit, d.datfrozenxid, age(d.datfrozenxid) AS age, datistemplate, datallowconn,
       pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(d.datdba) as owner, pg_catalog.pg_encoding_to_char(d.encoding) as encoding,
       d.datcollate, d.datctype,
       t.spcname as tablespace
FROM pg_catalog.pg_database d JOIN pg_catalog.pg_tablespace t on d.dattablespace = t.oid JOIN pg_stat_database psd on d.oid = psd.datid
WHERE d.datname = '$datname'
ORDER BY 1;
SELECT unnest(datacl) AS name FROM pg_database WHERE datname = '$datname';

panels.description: ins = ${ins}, used as unique instance identifier.
panels.title: Instance

targets.rawSql: SELECT pg_is_in_recovery()::INTEGER AS recovery

panels.description: cls = ${cls}. Used as an unique cluster identifier and resource namespace.
panels.title: Cluster

targets.rawSql: SELECT oid FROM pg_database WHERE datname = '$datname';

SELECT coalesce((data ->> 'r')::INTEGER, 0) AS "r",
       coalesce((data ->> 'i')::INTEGER, 0) AS "i",
       coalesce((data ->> 'S')::INTEGER, 0) AS "S",
       coalesce((data ->> 't')::INTEGER, 0) AS "t",
       coalesce((data ->> 'v')::INTEGER, 0) AS "v",
       coalesce((data ->> 'm')::INTEGER, 0) AS "m",
       coalesce((data ->> 'c')::INTEGER, 0) AS "c",
       coalesce((data ->> 'f')::INTEGER, 0) AS "f",
       coalesce((data ->> 'p')::INTEGER, 0) AS "p",
       coalesce((data ->> 'I')::INTEGER, 0) AS "I"
FROM (
         SELECT json_object_agg(kind, count) AS data
         FROM (SELECT relkind::TEXT AS kind, count(*) AS count FROM pg_class GROUP BY 1) d
     ) j;
SELECT pg_catalog.shobj_description(d.oid, 'pg_database') as description FROM pg_database d WHERE datname = '$datname';

SELECT
       relnamespace AS "OID", nspname AS "Schema", nspowner::RegRole::TEXT AS "Owner",
       coalesce((data ->> 'r')::INTEGER, 0) AS "r",
       coalesce((data ->> 'i')::INTEGER, 0) AS "i",
       coalesce((data ->> 'S')::INTEGER, 0) AS "S",
       coalesce((data ->> 't')::INTEGER, 0) AS "t",
       coalesce((data ->> 'v')::INTEGER, 0) AS "v",
       coalesce((data ->> 'm')::INTEGER, 0) AS "m",
       coalesce((data ->> 'c')::INTEGER, 0) AS "c",
       coalesce((data ->> 'f')::INTEGER, 0) AS "f",
       coalesce((data ->> 'p')::INTEGER, 0) AS "p",
       coalesce((data ->> 'I')::INTEGER, 0) AS "I"
FROM (
         SELECT relnamespace, json_object_agg(kind, count) AS data
         FROM (SELECT relnamespace, relkind::TEXT AS kind, count(*) AS count FROM pg_class GROUP BY 1,2) d
         GROUP BY 1
     ) j LEFT JOIN pg_namespace nsp ON j.relnamespace = nsp.oid
WHERE nspname NOT IN ('pg_toast', 'information_schema', 'pg_catalog');

SELECT c.oid                                                AS "OID",
       n.nspname                                            as "Schema",
       n.nspname || '.' || c.relname                        as "Name",
       CASE WHEN relispartition THEN 'P' ELSE c.relkind END AS "Kind",
       age(c.relfrozenxid)::FLOAT / 2147483648              AS relage,
       reltuples,
       relpages,
       relfilenode,
       pg_table_size(c.oid)                                 AS "Size",
       relnatts, s.*
FROM pg_catalog.pg_class c
         LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
         LEFT JOIN pg_stat_user_tables s ON c.oid = s.relid
WHERE c.relkind IN ('r', 'p', '')
  AND n.nspname <> 'pg_catalog'
  AND n.nspname !~ '^pg_toast'
  AND n.nspname <> 'information_schema'
ORDER BY 1, 2;

SELECT schemaname || '.' || indexrelname   AS "Name", 
       *,
       pg_get_indexdef(indexrelid) AS def
FROM pg_stat_user_indexes;

panels.description: Bloat ratio & wasted bytes estimation of all heap tables

targets.rawSql: SELECT nspname || '.' || relname AS relname, size, ratio, size * ratio AS waste FROM monitor.pg_table_bloat;

panels.title: Table Bloat

panels.description: Bloat ratio & wasted bytes estimation of all btree indexes

targets.rawSql: SELECT nspname || '.' || relname AS relname, size, ratio, size * ratio AS waste FROM monitor.pg_index_bloat;

panels.title: Index Bloat

targets.rawSql: SELECT nspname || '.' || relname AS relname, nspname, size * ratio AS waste, ratio FROM monitor.pg_table_bloat;
SELECT nspname || '.' || relname AS relname, nspname, size * ratio AS waste, ratio FROM monitor.pg_index_bloat;

SELECT *,
  extract(epoch from now() - backend_start) AS conn_time,
  extract(epoch from now() - xact_start)    AS xact_time,
  extract(epoch from now() - query_start)   AS query_time,
  extract(epoch from now() - state_change)  AS state_time
FROM pg_stat_activity Where datname = '$datname';

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(backend_type, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
WHERE datname = '$datname'
GROUP BY coalesce(backend_type, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(state, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
WHERE datname = '$datname'
GROUP BY coalesce(state, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(wait_event, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
WHERE datname = '$datname'
GROUP BY coalesce(wait_event, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(client_addr::text, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
WHERE datname = '$datname'
GROUP BY coalesce(client_addr::text, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(usename, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
WHERE datname = '$datname'
GROUP BY coalesce(usename, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(application_name, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
WHERE datname = '$datname'
GROUP BY 2;

SELECT queryid::TEXT AS qid, d.datname, r.rolname, s.*
FROM monitor.pg_stat_statements s
LEFT JOIN pg_database d ON s.dbid = d.oid
     LEFT JOIN pg_roles r ON s.userid = r.oid 
WHERE datname='$datname'     
ORDER BY rows DESC LIMIT 200;

panels.description:
Area represent time spent
color represent RT of this query

targets.rawSql:
SELECT queryid::TEXT                     AS query,
       sum(total_exec_time)              AS time_spent,
       sum(calls)                        AS calls,
       sum(total_exec_time) / sum(calls) AS rt
FROM (
         SELECT queryid, total_exec_time, calls
         FROM monitor.pg_stat_statements s
         WHERE dbid = (SELECT oid FROM pg_database WHERE datname = '$datname')
         ORDER BY rows DESC
         LIMIT 200
     ) raw
WHERE calls > 0
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC;

panels.title: Query (by Time Spent)

panels.description:
Area represent call counts
color represent RT of this query

targets.rawSql:
SELECT queryid::TEXT                     AS query,
       sum(total_exec_time)              AS time_spent,
       sum(calls)                        AS calls,
       sum(total_exec_time) / sum(calls) AS rt
FROM (
         SELECT queryid, total_exec_time, calls
         FROM monitor.pg_stat_statements s
         WHERE dbid = (SELECT oid FROM pg_database WHERE datname = '$datname')
         ORDER BY rows DESC
         LIMIT 200
     ) raw
WHERE calls > 0
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 DESC;

panels.title: Query (by Total Calls)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT *, 
CASE WHEN pg_is_in_recovery() THEN pg_last_wal_replay_lsn() ELSE pg_current_wal_lsn() END - restart_lsn AS retain 
FROM pg_replication_slots 
WHERE slot_type = 'logical';

panels.description: The pg_stat_wal_receiver view will contain only one row, showing statistics about the WAL receiver from that receiver's connected server.

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_stat_subscription;

panels.title: Subscription

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_publication;

title: PGCAT Database
